data: Verify that an 'Admit to' Order has been entered prior to completing the powerplan (NOT required for direct admit patients)
q12h, heart rate, blood pressure, respiratory rate, temperature
q1h, heart rate, blood pressure, respiratory rate, temperature
q2h, heart rate, blood pressure, respiratory rate, temperature
q4h, heart rate, blood pressure, respiratory rate, temperature
Check before meals, at HS and 0300h
Check before meals, snacks, at HS, midnight and 0300h
Check before meals and at HS
Review the most current diet order for therapeutic requirements, food texture and fluid thickness. Add anything to be carried forward to the new Diet Order
Therapeutic Diet: Diabetes Pediatric Newly Diagnosed, 3 meals and 3 snacks
Therapeutic Diet: Diabetes Pediatric Newly Diagnosed, Gluten Free, 3 meals and 3 snacks
Therapeutic Diet: Diabetes Pediatric Newly Diagnosed, No Pork, 3 meals and 3 snacks

Therapeutic Diet: Diabetes Standard, Gluten Free, 3 meals and 3 snacks
Therapeutic Diet: Diabetes Standard, No Pork, 3 meals and 3 snacks
Therapeutic Diet: Diabetes Standard, Vegetarian, 3 meals and 3 snacks
Age: 6-8 months, Texture: Pureed, Therapeutic Diet: Diabetes Standard, 3 meals and 3 snacks [6 - 9 month]
Age: 9-12 months, Texture: Minced | Finger Food, Therapeutic Diet: Diabetes Standard, 3 meals and 3 snacks [9 - 13 month]
Age: 1-3 years, Texture: Cut Up, Therapeutic Diet: Diabetes Standard, 3 meals and 3 snacks [1 - 4 year]
Age: 4-8 years, Texture: Regular, Therapeutic Diet: Diabetes Standard, 3 meals and 3 snacks [4 - 9 year]
Age: 9-13 years, Texture: Regular, Therapeutic Diet: Diabetes Standard, 3 meals and 3 snacks [9 - 14 year]
Age: 14-18 years, Texture: Regular, Therapeutic Diet: Diabetes Standard, 3 meals and 3 snacks [14 - 19 year]
PED Peripheral IV and IV Fluids (Module)
If/when POC Glucose Whole Blood is LESS than 4 mmol/L, then follow Hypoglycemia protocol in children with diabetes mellitus
PED ENDO Hypoglycemia for Patients with Diabetes Mellitus (Module)

For pain management orders, including anti-emetics and antipyretics, use either the  PED Pain and Symptom Management for Age Greater than or Equal to 6 months powerplan OR PED Pain and Symptom Management for Age Less than 6 Months powerplan
For LGH patients Only - For insulin pump orders, please continue to use the LGH Pediatric Insulin Pump Therapy orders (VCH.CO.LGH.0136)

Conditional Order - Nurse to Place Lab Order - Ongoing
If/when POC Glucose Whole Blood is greater than 15 mmol/L, then RN to place order for Urinalysis Macroscopic (dipstick)
If LGH patient Notify Pediatric Endocrinologist of hospital admission
